meanings.sent1: The kids were amped for the school field trip.
meanings.sent2: She always feels amped before a big game.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was so amped, it ran in circles around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The crowd's amped energy filled the stadium.
meanings.sent5: His amped enthusiasm was contagious to everyone around him.

meanings.definition: To increase the power or intensity of something.
meanings.sent1: He amped up the volume on the stereo to hear the music better.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to amp the spices in the dish for more flavor.
meanings.sent3: The magician amped the magic trick to make it more impressive.
meanings.sent4: The storm amped the wind to howling levels.
meanings.sent5: She amped her workout routine to challenge herself more.

meanings.definition: To be under the influence of amphetamines.
meanings.sent1: He was caught driving while amped and was arrested.
meanings.sent2: The athlete tested positive for being amped during the competition.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed amped as it darted around the park.
meanings.sent4: The partygoers were amped, dancing all night long.
meanings.sent5: She realized she was amped after taking the wrong medication.
